verses.verse: (A Song of Ascents, of David.) O Lord, <WH3068> my heart <WH3820> is not proud, <WH1361> nor <WH3808> my eyes <WH5869> haughty; <WH7311> Nor <WH3808> do I involve <WH1980> myself in great <WH1419> matters, Or in things <WH6381> too <WH4480> difficult <WH6381> for me.

Surely <WH518> <WH3808> I have composed <WH9586> and quieted <WH1826> my soul; <WH5315> Like a weaned <WH1580> child [rests] against <WH5921> his mother, <WH517> My soul <WH5315> is like a weaned <WH1580> child within <WH5921> me.
O Israel, <WH3478> hope <WH3176> in the Lord <WH3068> From this <WH6258> time <WH6258> forth and forever. <WH5704> <WH5769>
